meanings.sent1: The rubber gloves are nonconducting, so they keep you safe from electric shocks.
meanings.sent2: The plastic ruler is nonconducting, which means it won't conduct electricity.
meanings.sent3: The nonconducting blanket made the electric blanket useless during the power outage.
meanings.sent4: Her nonconducting personality was like an insulating barrier, keeping others at a distance.
meanings.sent5: The nonconducting material acted like a shield against the electric current.

meanings.definition: Not allowing the flow of electricity.
meanings.sent1: The nonconducting material blocked the electrical current from passing through.
meanings.sent2: The nonconducting barrier prevented any electricity from getting through.
meanings.sent3: The nonconducting wall played a game of 'keep away' with the electricity.
meanings.sent4: Her nonconducting thoughts were like a dam, stopping the flow of ideas.
meanings.sent5: The nonconducting substance acted as a solid wall against the electrical flow.

meanings.definition: Lacking the ability to conduct heat or electricity.
meanings.sent1: The nonconducting material couldn't transfer heat from one side to the other.
meanings.sent2: The nonconducting wire didn't allow the heat to pass through.
meanings.sent3: The nonconducting pot kept the soup cold instead of hot.
meanings.sent4: His nonconducting touch felt like ice against her skin.
meanings.sent5: The nonconducting surface refused to share its warmth with the room.
